website_summaries.verdict: A pricey hard-shell cargo box that is praised for its overall quality, design, and durability.
cons: Smaller opening (13.5 inches) makes it difficult to insert some suitcases

customer_reviews.title: Arrived defective
customer_reviews.text: The shipping box arrived in good condition. However there was damage from the factory that should never have passed inspection. At the factory the lid had enough force on the center latch bar assembly to cause cracks in the lid. As there was no force from the exterior of the box, the damage could not have occurred elsewhere. I have started a warranty claim with Yakima.
customer_reviews.author: Ricochet

customer_reviews.title: Nice box to haul fishing gear around and keep the sand out of my car.
customer_reviews.text: Just put it on my Mazdaspeed 3. Took about 10 minutes to put on by myself, not too bad. I did lose a little clearance on my hatch, as it does hit the cargo box even in the most forward position. Unfortunately I can't open the box much when I am hauling my kayak as well on the J cradles, but that is no fault of the box, just the low profile Thule Aerobars that I have. I haven't driven with it yet, just loaded it up with some fishing gear to see how things fit. So far, so good.
customer_reviews.author: Dan M

customer_reviews.title: Simple installation
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Skybox 12 which is much easier to handle solo than the 16. It is similar but much lighter, to handling a kayak and is simple to place on top of my Subaru Crosstrek. I was initially concerned that it would not fit, but the mounts are adjustable sliding front and back and locked afterward. It took me about 15-20 minutes initially and will take about five minutes for subsequent mounts. I did not notice anything different when driving in town and on the interstate at 65 mph. I will follow-up with a mileage update after a trip. Overall, I am very pleased with the Skybox!
customer_reviews.author: Mikie1962

customer_reviews.title: Works quite well. Not $600 well.
customer_reviews.text: We're a year into owning this thing sitting on a Honda Odyssey. Recently started encountering dust/debris/water getting inside it, as well as one side of the box refusing to open despite there being no gear obstructing the hinges. All that would be okay by me if it wasn't $600. Preposterously priced if it isn't bulletproof reliable, and it's not. Pros: - Looks the least awkward - Holds a ton of gear for its size - Installs easy for two people and a step ladder - Gives you a bit more peace of mind re: parking garage ceilings and air resistance Cons: - Too expensive to have lock mechanism issues and debris/water getting inside
customer_reviews.author: Mitchell D. Turck

customer_reviews.title: Game changer, but big and ‘fiddly’
customer_reviews.text: I like the Yakima Skybox greatly, and my family loved it for a recent 5k mike trip! No issues whatsoever, although I would highlight a few items: - It’s big - while I could get on myself, you realistically need two people to easily mount - The locks and handles are good, but a little ‘fiddly’. One needs to whack the Skybox occasionally to get everything into locking position Overall, a game changer for my family of 5 plus 1 dog!
customer_reviews.author: Logan S. McDougal

customer_reviews.title: Worth the investment
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this for our land rover discovery 7 seater. We coupled this with the rhino rails. We did a road trip from cali to utah and this thing saved us a ton of room in the car. We positioned it so we could still open our sun roof and open the tail gate fully with no issues. Just wish my garage door was bigger to make storage easier, but thats a mute point.
customer_reviews.author: topraman

customer_reviews.title: Bummed out
customer_reviews.text: I got the biggest one they had that was SUPPOSE TO fit my vehicle. I had to send the first one back due to lock issues. It's so long that when trying to open the hatch on my SUV(Toyota Highlander) this cargo box will not allow the hatch to open completely making it difficult to unload luggage and items from the back. Now I have a new cargo box in my garage(still in the box it came in) that will be a pain to use and I'm not sure what route to take next. It hold a lot but doesn't exactly fit my needs or my vehicle as advertised. Quality Yakima product.
customer_reviews.author: Craig D Keeney

customer_reviews.title: It mounted up perfectly and was really easy to install
customer_reviews.text: We ordered this for our multiple trips a year we make across Country to visit family. Around 78-80 MPH the Box vibrates on my racks. I own a 2013 Subaru Outback. It mounted up perfectly and was really easy to install. The vibration was really annoying when driving. I tried to space it out to the widest part but that did not help either. We fixed the vibration by buying some foam tape and placing them on the areas where it was vibrating. However, this box did fit everything!! Literally doubled the storage in my Subaru.
customer_reviews.author: John Shugart

customer_reviews.title: Mediocre, especially for the price.
customer_reviews.text: The way this device is Designed, it can open on either side, which as it turns out is it’s Achilles’ heel. I’m finding it comes off the track on whichever side you don’t open on occasion, which is a nightmare to fix the thing is mounted to your roof. For the course of this thing it should be much more reliable and sturdy
customer_reviews.author: P. KAT

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Fit my 2019 Toyota Highlander perfectly. We took a road trip with the two kids and my parents. We were able to keep the inside of the car clear and roomy and the box was big enough for all of our stuff. It is really big. When it was delivered, I thought oh crap! We will never be able to lift it onto the car, but it was surprisingly lightweight. And even though it is lightweight it was still sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Liz

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit for my Yukon
customer_reviews.text: First, if you get one, check the shipment before acceptance. Not Amazons fault, but the first one I got was dented. Second one was not. I was able to put this on my 2017 Yukon with help of a second person. It fit perfectly and also allowed me to be able to get into the rear hatch. It did not affect the sunroof at all. I also have a 2011 Enclave and it fits on that one as well. It did affect the MPG but only slightly (guesstimate of about .4-.5 MPG). Best part, at 80mph in the Yukon, very little wind noise.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great box for the job
customer_reviews.text: We Bought it for our 2015 outback,works nicely with the factory rack. The back hatch door is slightly touching the box on max top position. the installation was fairly ok, it did fell once after me and my wife tried to lift it to the car rack.! This box is huge and not akin for one person. My only problem is that you pay $ 500 and get 2 small cheap and flimsy keys - we already broke one when the box fell on its side and the key was left in the lock...So we were left with only one stupid key for both locks. Seriously, I used to have a much biffier key for my bike small chain lock.
customer_reviews.author: esther

customer_reviews.title: Yakima makes the finest rooftop cargo box on the market today !! Bar None .
customer_reviews.text: I could not be more pleased with this Yakima product . It has a large capacity and left room inside my 2016 Toyota Sienna for my coolers and musical instruments . I could not discern one iota of difference in fuel mileage and it makes no noise in the wind , unlike my old rooftop carrier of a different brand . Yakima has obviously put a great deal of research and development into this fine product ; it does exactly what it was designed for . My son - in - law has used one just like this for years and it has given him great service and longevity .
customer_reviews.author: woodsnipe

customer_reviews.title: Really nice
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice quality cargo carrier and much nicer then others out there. It looks great and is super easy to take it on and off thanks to the features. I installed a harness in my garage to store it and I only need to lower it to the roof which makes the process that much easier. It is more money than others as well however well worth the extra cost.
customer_reviews.author: MC

customer_reviews.title: Nice tall long box for when height is an issue
customer_reviews.text: 1st delivery was smashed. Amazon return policy was crazy easy. 2nd delivery the item is intact. This box is special because it can be opened from either side and because its taller than any of the other long boxes out there. I needed extra height to hold the pedal drive on my fishing kayak and the length to hold fishing poles. Price was more reasonable then many of the other boxes. Holding up well so far.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara

customer_reviews.title: Nice box!
customer_reviews.text: Don't leave home without it. I've used the same size Thule and this Yakima Skybox. This one take the trophy... and all your stuff too! I wouldn't even consider not having this Skybox on my roof. Looks great. Minimal wind noise. Strong locking. Perfect. Nice box! Even like the golfball stle dimples. They must make it fly better.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick M.

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: Simply the best hard-shell rooftop cargo carrier you can buy. Like other reviewers, I was worried this product would stick out over the front wind-shield, or prevent the back hatch from opening fully. It doesn't in either case. It is also completely quiet at 80mph, unlike many other rooftop units I've tried. I would completely forget it was up there if it didn't change the aerodynamics of my van. I also drove through a helluva storm and was relieved when I found that all my gear still stayed completely dry. It's more expensive than the rest, but worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Feagins

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Quality and design
customer_reviews.text: Excellent Cargo Carrier. For our 13 Honda Pilot.. Easy to Secure. Excellent Storage Capacity. No noise. Used it for a trip from Wyoming to Colorado. Luggage stayed dry in the snow. Did not move or make noise even going through Wyoming with 85+ MPH side wind and storm. Survived the heavy winds and snow like a champ.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Big box that looks great!
customer_reviews.text: This looks great on my 2014 Ford Flex LTD. I love that it opens from either side. It is BIG. I should have plenty of room for luggage now, since the Flex is limited in that regard. I paired this with the Yakima S56 Whispbar cross bars to attach to my factory raised rails (using 50 mm long bolts to replace the ones that came with the cross bars.)
customer_reviews.author: TL

customer_reviews.title: Worked great on 2016 Highlander, very happy.
customer_reviews.text: Used on my 2016 Highlander limited. Didn't hang over the front at all, and the lift gate opened fully without touching. We put this on the factory horizontal bars and it worked perfectly. Really couldn't tell it was there, didn't notice any noise. Was a little hard to close when totally full, but it's a nice feature that you can't get the key out unless it's 100% locked. We took it about 5500 miles round trip, and we were very happy with it. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: DK

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Great durable product! Fits perfect on our 2015 KIA Sorento with factory crossbars. We were on the fence about which size to get because we didn’t want it to touch the antenna in the back. The 21 cu ft clears the antenna perfectly! We can fit so much stuff in here. Perfect for camping and ski trips!
customer_reviews.author: cbugai

customer_reviews.title: Awesome cargo box!
customer_reviews.text: Have been using Yakima products for years with great results, this box is no exception. Box seemed flimsy but actually it's just flexible as your loading it, which helps and makes it lighter. The box is huge! Biggest benefit is that you can't hear it at all, didn't change the characteristics of our GMC Acadia a bit. We were worried about its durability, time will tell but it seems great thus far. We went through one of the worst rain storms at over 70 mph, no problem and everything stayed perfectly dry, it's expensive but that was worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Its nice and sleek but huge for my 2011 CRV it ...
customer_reviews.text: So far i only attached it to the top of my car, no gears have yet been put to the test as of yet. Suggestion use two people to install this i did it on my own and it took a little longer than expected. No affect on my MPG. Its nice and sleek but huge for my 2011 CRV it took most of the factory racks. Overall excellent product.
customer_reviews.author: Vireak M.

customer_reviews.title: We just tested our new skybox over the holiday weekend ...
customer_reviews.text: We just tested our new skybox over the holiday weekend. The 21 foot capacity was able to hold all of our luggage for a family of 6 for a weekend getaway with room to spare. It fit securely on the factory racks of our 2005 Toyota Sienna. We are able to open the rear hatch without any interference from the box. The clearance is about 7'8" on our van. We were able to take it in some underground parking, but not all. We could never hear a thing while driving. We also purchased the cargo net which was very helpful. We feel confident it will serve us well on our next long road trip.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel L.

customer_reviews.title: A fantastic product. It works perfectly for what it is ...
customer_reviews.text: A fantastic product. It works perfectly for what it is designed for. With the size 21 box you can fit and amazing amount of gear. The box is easy to attach and has a nice sleek look to it. Used it many times and have had no issues. Absolutely a necessity for carrying lots of gear.
customer_reviews.author: BigMike56

customer_reviews.title: Great Cargo box choice for Large SUV
customer_reviews.text: The 18 square foot box was perfect size for trip for 8 on top of a 2015 GMC Yukon SLT. Although there was one bigger, the one we bought would fit a smaller next car and didn't take up as much space when storing on a vertical wall in garage, as it will probably be used once in summer and maybe in winter for skiing. Could not hear the unit on top of car with respect to wind resistance. very good design.
customer_reviews.author: j merrick

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for most cases, but some mounting issues possible
customer_reviews.text: In general, probably the best product of this type on the market - long, slim profile, opens from both sides. 1 star off because of limited longitudinal and no tilt adjustment on the mounts - placing it on Toyota Venza makes the box looking upward, and obstructing hatch door. Still usable, but will need to design custom mounts to level it.
customer_reviews.author: Sandel

customer_reviews.title: Carrier for the subie
customer_reviews.text: This carrier is easy to attach to the top of my car and load. I can easily fit all our ski gear for a family of 4, and still have room for more. When driving down the road you don't even notice it's on the car due to its aerodynamic shape. It even fits on my little crosstrek.
customer_reviews.author: Jackel0714

customer_reviews.title: Sleek, roomy, and does the job
customer_reviews.text: The 21 cf box is heavier than I would like, but to travels well and holds a lot of bulk that would be traveling inside my cargo area
customer_reviews.author: GRIZZZZ

customer_reviews.title: Lots of room.
customer_reviews.text: Got this for a recent trip up into the mountains with my Xterra. Worked really well. Kind of a pain to get initially mounted on the roof and aligned properly, but after you get it on there's a ton of a room for stuff inside and it stays put with no rattling. We were able to fit two small suitcases, a large glider plane, two camping chairs, a medium bag of charcoal, a medium dufflebag, and a bunch of bedding linen.
customer_reviews.author: L. Kampsnider

customer_reviews.title: Skybox on Mitsubishi Outlander
customer_reviews.text: The Skybox was easy to install and good construction. Fits Mitsubishi Outlander. As soon as we installed the Skybox we went on a 800 mile round trip. We did not encounter any issues and it did rain several times. No leaks and our luggage was completely dry. You have to ensure that the lip is securely fitted over the bottom portion all the way around. Good product. We got the 18 cubic feet and have a family of 4.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Eldridge

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't be happier with our choice
customer_reviews.text: Very impressed with the quality. Very sleek, nice looking roofbox. A big improvement to the RocketBox 11 that we bought years ago. Love the internal roof rack clamping mechanism, which is far easier and faster than the RocketBox model. Great feature is the cover that can be opened and closed with one hand because it is more rigid. Locking mechanism works very well and shape at back of box allows for more storage. Overall very satisfied and would consider replacing our Rocketbox for another one of these.
customer_reviews.author: KindKitchen

customer_reviews.title: Skybox 12 Fit perfect
customer_reviews.text: Fits perfect on our 2018 Toyota Highlander. The rear hatch opens with a few inches to spare with no adjustments made. Don't hear any rattling, just a slight wind noise that is hardly noticeable. the size of the Skybox 12 takes up less than half our car roof so we can still enjoy the sun roof view.
customer_reviews.author: loki54

customer_reviews.title: Yakima 18 Carbonite
customer_reviews.text: Installs easily, well constructed, swallows a lot of gear. Was able to take 3 adult boys on fishing trip to Canada and drive my Subaru Outback using the Yakima 18. No problems in driving, no vibrations or unusual noises. It pays to buy quality!!!
customer_reviews.author: mgnut

customer_reviews.title: Versatility
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to mount, mine arrived pretty much assembled. Been using it for about two months now, no issues at all. It opens from both sides, this makes it for me, the ability to open and lock on either side makes a world of difference when loading gear.
customer_reviews.author: Gaming

customer_reviews.title: Great quality product and very spacious
customer_reviews.text: Great quality product and very spacious! Do take note that because this is one of the biggest size, weight is also high. It means it would reduce the capacity you can put in terms of weight (per safety requirements and hardware compatibility e.g. Box itself, your car frame, bracket etc.)
customer_reviews.author: sincerebuyer

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this purchase
customer_reviews.text: Light but very strong. I get a reduction of 5% on gas mileage on my Sorento. I expected much more. The cargo box doesn't noticably transfer energy from side winds either. Very happy with this purchase. Also, the box is comes in is great for kids to play 'fort' in.
customer_reviews.author: KE

customer_reviews.title: Love it! Took it on two trips so far ...
customer_reviews.text: Love it! Took it on two trips so far and was able to fit everything I needed leaving tons of space in my car (Hyundai Santa Fe) for my three dogs. Simply the best thing I ever bought for my car. I'm able to install and remove it by myself in about 5 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: P. Mancini

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: Works for our family. Had it mounted on a Suburban, now a Sequoia. Saves space, but have to remind the wife not to pull into the garage . . . still OK there! :)
customer_reviews.author: AmazonCustomer

customer_reviews.title: Much better than the soft-sided one we had for a couple ...
customer_reviews.text: Very roomy, attaches securely to the car, and closes securely - everything you could possibly want in a cartop carrier. Much better than the soft-sided one we had for a couple of years. Fits great on our Subaru Outback.
customer_reviews.author: Avid Reader

customer_reviews.title: Nice big and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: This box did great for traveling with our four kids. We got the big one and we were able to put quite a bit in it. The only problem we had was that it's tricky to open, needs some practice! One time I opened it from one side and somehow didn't fully close it right and my husband opened it from the other the next day and because it wasn't closed right the wind blew it all the way up and open and we had to wrestle it closed! Don't let both sides open! Haha. It worked well other than that. :)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great quality!
customer_reviews.text: I used this product for the first time this weekend, and it worked great. The conditions were really snowy and the skybox didn't leak. The quality is great and it is really easy to use. Assembly is pretty simple as well. I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: BNM

customer_reviews.title: Huge and great quality.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is huge! Quiet, not too heavy, tones of storage. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Z

customer_reviews.title: Great buy for our family
customer_reviews.text: I just used it on a road trip to Arizona and it worked great. It had way more room then I expected, everything stayed dry and in place. My husband said it was easy to install and it looks great on my car. I hardly noticed it was on my car while droving and I don't think it effected the gas mileage that much. I got about 17mpg in a 2011 Chevy Tahoe. Going about 80mph the whole time.
customer_reviews.author: NAOMI

customer_reviews.title: It was very easy to install on my Subaru Outback
customer_reviews.text: The product was shipped exactly as it said. It was very easy to install on my Subaru Outback. I could put it on and off by myself. I drove on the express way the first day it was on and no noise. It is the perfect length because I can fit my SUP paddles in it and still fit my paddle board next to it. It also clears my tailgate. I did research this cargo box for exactly what I needed and it meets all expectations. Great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Stacey

customer_reviews.title: Great overhead storage product!
customer_reviews.text: This item arrived on time and has worked perfectly! Definitely takes two people to install on top of car the first time. We traveled from Chicago to Canada for hockey tournament and it fit two large hockey bags and sticks---not much room left for anything else but that is exactly what I wanted to hold. Very large and easy to use-- no leakage from rain and did not slow the car down at all. Also, it did not add any noise --in fact I forgot it was on top during the travel. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Christy L.

customer_reviews.title: 3rd row kid looking forward to the extra space
customer_reviews.text: Installed on a 2013 town and country with factory roof rack. The thumb wheels and latches are spread to their furthest position but it fits. There is slight interference with the rear tailgate but it's workable.we have an 8 foot garage door so we'll be able to pull in and out with it attached. No long trip yet but looking forward to the extra space in the van on those long ski and camping trips!
customer_reviews.author: Molly Cole

customer_reviews.title: Poor initial quality but does the job
customer_reviews.text: This seems like it'll do the job for our cross-country road trip. Be advised, it is long enough that it interferes with the back lift-gate on our Nissan Rogue. The lift-gate still works, just doesn't open all the way. Also, in-factory assembly or packaging needs improvement. Ours arrived with a damaged lip, but I didn't order it with enough time for a return so we're going to try to use it. If you order make sure you have enough time to return it! I expected higher initial quality at this price point.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Lenaway

customer_reviews.title: See photos!!  Strong and versatile. Another quality Yakima product.
customer_reviews.text: See photo!! This item is strong and versatile. I'm currently running this in my camp trailer. Keeps everything locked up and dry. You can't lose. I picket up the largest one. As you can see I'm a Yakima fan. We use this container every weekend. Top notch.
customer_reviews.author: Kouri

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install, exceptionally well made, increases cargo space of vehicle beautifully. Fits on my 2013 Hyundai Santa Fe with factory racks perfectly, despite Yakima telling me that it would not. Love the locking mechanism, the durable finish, capability to open from both sides. One thing I might reconsider is going to the 21. The added height would be nice sometimes.
customer_reviews.author: Okanagan Outdoorsman

customer_reviews.title: Love the updates to this product!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome. Easy to get on my car. Looks cool (really like the dimpled exterior) and I would highly recommend this new version as it isn't any more expensive than the old. Going on the first trip this weekend and will report back on wind noise, etc. upon our return!
customer_reviews.author: anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Style and Function
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this Skybox and received it timely on the scheduled day and time. It looks great on our van and has a ton of room for our inflatable kayak, SUP boards, PFDs, oars and paddles. The mounting system is well engineered and easy to attach. The SKS is effective and gives us a sense of security with our gear 👍🏻👍🏻
customer_reviews.author: David Czanowski

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: We absolutely love this. It is for our subuaru tribeca and it looks great on top. We had it for our first trip visiting family for utah. We loaded it and it was so nice! It kind of wobbles so it worried me but i noticed others were the same. Our gas mileage goes down 2 mpg but it really is worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Raschel S.

customer_reviews.title: The 21 Cubic Foot (CF) box fits great on the truck
customer_reviews.text: The 21 Cubic Foot (CF) box fits great on the truck. It sits forward of the antenna and does not hang over the windshield. I was able to fill it and had no trouble with the box, it did not shift during driving. I can just reach/access it without climbing up the side of the truck. When we stopped on our trip, occasionally we would grab a clothing item out and close it. It was bigger than I expected, 14 CF would probably be more practical, but I am happy to have the extra capacity.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Planner

customer_reviews.title: Awesome box and support from Yakima
customer_reviews.text: Works like a dream ... No issues with 2018 Subaru Outback hatch clearance using Yakima towers and bars.
customer_reviews.author: Forest

customer_reviews.title: Great box but be careful with the key
customer_reviews.text: The product came timely and seemed easy to set up. Unfortunately, the key broke in the lock with very little effort. Don't try to pop the top when both locks are open. This leads to the top unclamped and impossible to put back. Amazon graciously replaced it in record time. I wish the key wasn't so flimsy. My second attempt at installation was flawless and took less than 20 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Would not buy for SUVs
customer_reviews.text: Mounts easy enough. It said it would fit my 2019 4runner but you cant open the rear tailgate while box is on roof.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: High speed running
customer_reviews.text: We secured use of a wind tunnel, and in case anyone is concerned, this Skybox 21 handled sustained runs of 90-100 without incident, even with simulated cross winds
customer_reviews.author: Altitude

customer_reviews.title: Made luggage storage very easy. Though I wish you could fully open it ...
customer_reviews.text: Hooked right to a Yakima rail grab kit. Made luggage storage very easy. Though I wish you could fully open it for better access.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Love ours
customer_reviews.text: Sleek and good looking all while serving the purpose of carrying our luggage. Great buy. It locks to the roof and cannot be removed without the key.
customer_reviews.author: India

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy and traveled nearly 1000 miles on it with loaded ...
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy and traveled nearly 1000 miles on it with loaded cargo (using Thule Aeroblade) one way! Amazing product with very super fast shipping! it beat all of its committed delivery/arrival date! Very happy with the purchase and highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: sincerebuyer

customer_reviews.title: Good box but very expensive.
customer_reviews.text: Very good box, not very heavy, I can manage it on my own. It is a bit pricey at $600.00
customer_reviews.author: Adnan

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Have loved this skybox! Super easy to get on and off the van. We’ve taken it on a 3000 mile trip and had zero issues with it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Works great, easy to access, just the right fit on our Honda Odyssey. Travelled over 4,000 miles and it held up like a champ, even through heavy rain storms and wind.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: but its a nearly perfect fit. The hatch bumps the back but only ...
customer_reviews.text: My Yakima Skybox 18 arrived on time and as described. I had some worry about it fitting on my Outback, but its a nearly perfect fit. The hatch bumps the back but only once fully opened, so you still have plenty of clearance. The box mounts easily and is simple to use. This is my first roof-top cargo box, so I have nothing to compare it to, but it appears to be constructed of better materials than Thule boxes. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: A solid product, expensive but solid if you have kids/animals and need to transport them all.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Lanza

customer_reviews.title: Fits good so far
customer_reviews.text: Haven't taken it on the road but threw it on and set it up just to try it out. 2015 Tahoe Z71 factory crossbars- fits good as far as I can tell. I had to set the auto hatch to 3/4 or I'd anticipate clearance issues. A bit of a learning curve on the hook adjustment but wasn't too bad.
customer_reviews.author: Erik C.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product!
customer_reviews.text: The Yakima Skybox 21 Carbonite Cargo Box is an awesome product... more cargo space than we had expected. The product is rugged and secure; looks great on our SUV. Many thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Lacy D. Jolin-Nhye

customer_reviews.title: Fits and looks great (some might even say
customer_reviews.text: Fits and looks great on my 14 Forester XT, but after a long road trip from Denver to Moab there's definitely a hit to MPG, maybe even up to 6 miles in high speeds. But 5 stars anyway since wind drag is a factor for any of these boxes.
customer_reviews.author: C. High

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: It went on easy locks down quickly and seems very durable. Great that it opens from either side. Would buy it again
customer_reviews.author: Michael M.

customer_reviews.title: Works good on 13 Jeep Grand Cherokee
customer_reviews.text: Works good on 13 Jeep Grand Cherokee. Might want to consider the 15 though. The 18 runs slightly in the hatch spoiler when you open the hatch. I have it as far forward as it can go. It does have wind noise at highway speeds but it's not unbearable.
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Ski and Luggage carrier
customer_reviews.text: Excellent container. It turns out that it was bigger than I needed. I really like how it clamps to the roof. highly recommend this carrier. 😊😊😊
customer_reviews.author: C. Lawrence

customer_reviews.title: Great Roof box!
customer_reviews.text: This is the larges roof box that Yakima makes, It has served me well with my camping equipment. It definitely frees up cargo space in my SUV. I would recommend to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: Georgiee33

customer_reviews.title: Cheap keys
customer_reviews.text: I dislike that I need it tomorrow and one of the keys broke before I even got it installed on my van. Buyer beware
customer_reviews.author: dcillusions77

customer_reviews.title: Love it. Real sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Fits all my camping gear so I have more room for friends' gear in my trunk. Love it. Real sturdy, lock works great. good size so I can fit my kayak rack on my roof as well.
customer_reviews.author: JerseyJ

customer_reviews.title: Skybox Rocks!!!
customer_reviews.text: The Skybox is absolutely awesome. I purchased this because ever since I started traveling with the dog inside and of course I want him to have enough space in the rear of my Subaru Forester this has added the additional space that I needed. It's light weight construction weighing in at ~43lbs makes it easy to lift and place on top of my car. The easy clamping system securely fastens the rack in seconds. I also purchased the netting to keep equipment in place when not fully loaded. Lastly, as for gas mileage I did not notice a drop in mileage with it on top. Therefore, it receives 5 STARS!!!
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Can't go wrong with a well brand named product. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Albie_10

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Fits great on the roof and locks in place in less then 1 minute. Travels great at 80 mph!
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Cole

customer_reviews.title: Ideal to leave on and forget it
customer_reviews.text: My XC90 fits in my garage with this on. It's not too bulky, low noise, can carry a decent amount of stuff. Used one season so far, leaving it on. Waterproof so far.
customer_reviews.author: Eastern Snowboarder

customer_reviews.title: Get one
customer_reviews.text: Love it. 21 is a bit big for 2014 Acura MDX. Took a week long trip with 7 person bags and Yakima saved the day.
customer_reviews.author: Amazoner

customer_reviews.title: Super product, I just spend 23 hours in the ...
customer_reviews.text: Super product, I just spend 23 hours in the car with this rack completely full, and I could not even tell it was there. Great design, easy to use, and no road noise.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product, lots of room
customer_reviews.text: Great product, lots of room. Very little if any added road noise. Fuel MPG stayed close to normal, dropping more in heavy cross wind of 25-40 mph gusts.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: GOOD product
customer_reviews.text: i like it ,, i just wish the locking clamps were little easier to work
customer_reviews.author: paul

customer_reviews.title: Works great. Definitely a two man job installing if you ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Definitely a two man job installing if you are older (I am 52). Be careful not to unhinge both sides, the top portion is a bear to get back in place.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent. A little tricky to mount on an SUV ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent. A little tricky to mount on an SUV solo - try getting help from a friend. Fits bunches of stuff, making a ski trip much more comfortable with lots of extra room in the passenger cabin. No significant wind noise. Felt very sturdy on top, no shifting noted.
customer_reviews.author: Hugh Dainer

customer_reviews.title: Mounted on 2014 Highlander LE
customer_reviews.text: I have yet to hit the open road with it. I mounted the skybox 21 on my 2014 Toyota Highlander LE on OEM style cross bars (also from Amazon). I will update this review after my 3k miles round trip road trip.
customer_reviews.author: Danny L

customer_reviews.title: Great for fam of 5!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a trip from Ohio to Florida. I have a 2006 Chrysler Town & Country with OEM cross bars. This fit perfectly, and we were able to transport a family of five (5) over 1100 miles. I like that it opens from both sides. I like that the clamps are adjustable and easy to adjust. I like that you can't accidentally lock the keys in the system. Very efficient. And I did not notice a discernible decrease in gas mileage or notice any discernible road noise.
customer_reviews.author: Dave H

customer_reviews.title: Great skybox. It did a great job stored a ...
customer_reviews.text: Great skybox. It did a great job stored a lot of my gears for my trips. Makes my trips easier and worry free. Easy to access on bother sides. It durable and lighter than it looks. I would recommend this products to other.
customer_reviews.author: Chau Duong

customer_reviews.title: We love our Shybox!!!
customer_reviews.text: Very quiet and easy to take on and off the car. Still amazed with how much stuff we can cram into it. My favorite feature is not being able to take the key out unless it is totally locked. No longer worry if it is completely shut while driving down the freeway.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Awesome cargo box
customer_reviews.text: Awesome cargo box! Plenty of space to hold all that we needed it to. We got rained on pretty bad and everything stayed dry. Mounts easily and Rides quietly on top of our SUV. I'm very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Joe B

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Got a great price on this. Really easy to install, holds a lot. I've driven it full and empty at speeds up to 80 mph. There was a little whistling noise, which I imagine is unavoidable, but it isn't all that noticeable. The box is sturdy though, no shaking - very secure. I have a GMC Acadia. I installed the OEM crossbars.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Allen

customer_reviews.title: Easy to attach to my Nissan Armada factory roof rack
customer_reviews.text: Big container! Easy to attach to my Nissan Armada factory roof rack. Used it for winter round trip from TEXAS to NEBRASKA. Hardly any noise and better mpg than when we used a cargo bag.
customer_reviews.author: Bart Thomsen

customer_reviews.title: My son just loves this Skybox!
customer_reviews.text: My son just loves this Skybox. The length will accommodate long skis and snowboards. The carbonite top is so quiet. You don't even know it is on top of your car. We mounted it on a 98 Jeep Grand Cherokee which already had a factory rack. It worked beautifully. The locks are a little tough to work at first. We sprayed dry graphite in the keyhole to help with the sticking key. Purchasing from Amazon's warehouse was the best. I'd advise anyone to look there when looking for something like this. Thank you Amazon, you made my son's Christmas!
customer_reviews.author: K. Byrne

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Used it twice so far
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Used it twice so far. Just thinner than we expected.
customer_reviews.author: fong718

customer_reviews.title: Keys snap, locks don’t work - faulty product
customer_reviews.text: Both keys have snapped off in the locks, rendering the product useless
customer_reviews.author: atlas123

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to attach to car and lots of room of all of our stuff!
customer_reviews.author: Teressa Steinbach

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful cargo carrier but did not fit my sons Toyota Tacoma
customer_reviews.author: yvonne

customer_reviews.title: Works good. I wish it would open higher for easier ...
customer_reviews.text: Works good. I wish it would open higher for easier access to gear. A bit tricky to close at first.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it!!!
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing! I been using it to keep snowboard/skis and gear so I can have full space in the back of my vehicle to sleep. It will carry a ton of gear! The noise is negligible. The box is a little heavier but I was able to install alone. I do notice a decrease in MPG. I have a 4cyl vehicle and I was anticipating that.Yakima's customer service is excellent. It was the best purchase I've made as an added feature to my vehicle. I have a Subaru Outback 2014 and the rear hatch clearance is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: L.G

customer_reviews.title: Good box as advertised by yakima
customer_reviews.text: Good box as advertised by yakima. Only gave 2 keys. But each key only unlocks one side. Need 4 keys. Easy to install and remove.can carry to carry on size luggage.
customer_reviews.author: Ray

product_meta.title: YAKIMA, SkyBox Aerodynamic Rooftop Cargo Box for Cars, Wagons and SUVs
product_meta.description:
Make room for friends with the next evolution of the SkyBox series. Versatile, sleek and aerodynamically designed to reduce drag and wind noise, this cargo box is ready for weekend adventures and road trips. It features internal lid stiffeners for durability and SuperLatch security system to keep your gear safe and sound. The quick-release mounting hardware fits most crossbars with a spread of 24 in - 42 in.

SkyBox 12: Weight: 41.00 lbs. Dimensions: L 92.00 in x W 24.00 in x H 16.00 in.
SkyBox 16: Weight: 47.00 lbs. Dimensions: L 81.00 in x W 36.00 in x H 15.00 in.
SkyBox 18: Weight: 52.00 lbs. Dimensions: L 92.00 in x W 36.00 in x H 16.00 in.
SkyBox 21: Weight: 62.00 lbs. Dimensions: L 92.0 0in x W 36.00 in x H 18.00 in.
feature_bullets: Sleek aerodynamic Carbonite textured lid; Designed with internal lid stiffeners for durability and easy open and close
SuperLatch security ensures your lid is secure to its base, and your gear is safe; Dual-sided opening for easy access on either side of your vehicle; Tapered design reduces hatch interference
No assembly required; Tool-free installation/removal from vehicle; SKS Locks included
Fits Yakima round, square, factory, and aerodynamic bars; Minimum and maximum crossbar spreads: 24" - 42"
Hauls gear for up to 5 campers; fits snowboards and skis up to 215cm; Available in five sizes: Lo, 12, 16, 18, and 21 cubic feet
